result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank D. Lashay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with C. Zindars directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to complete an Anger Managment Program together with any other counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frank D. Lashay

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:03 p.m. Defendant Frank D. Lashay in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Frank D. Lashay in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Repeater enhancer dismissed outright.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation concurrent with any other sentence currently being served - Conditions: $553.75 Restitution - the defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims, NC w/ C. Zindars, Anger Managment Program, any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

12CF149 & 16CF52. Defendant Frank D. Lashay in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Frank D. Lashay in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests 16CF52 be adjourned and makes statement regarding adjournment. Court grants adjournment-set for August 1, 2016 at 2:00pm for plea/sentencing. 12CF149-Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel. No errors or corrections. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 1-7 months WCJ & Count 2-6 months consecutive to each other. With credit for 284 days served. Court re-imposes costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

16CF52 & 12CF149-NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests SEHR on 12CF case and STC on 16CF matter.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Bond form from WC Jail - DE refused to sign
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

12CF149 & 16CF52 Cases called @ 2:53 p.m. Defendant Frank D. Lashay in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Frank D. Lashay in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF52 -   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  NGP entered. ADA Anderson requesting $5000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint. The parties are requesting that the SEHR in 12CF149 track along with 16CF52.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
